summary:
The United States Virgin Islands are a group of Caribbean islands that belong to the United States. They were once known as the Danish West Indies and were bought by the U.S. from Denmark in 1917. The islands include Saint Croix, Saint John, Saint Thomas, and many smaller ones. The capital is Charlotte Amalie.

The territory is an unincorporated organized area, meaning it has its own government but is still under U.S. rule. Tourism is the main industry. The islands have a unique history and are a popular vacation spot.
title: United States Virgin Islands
